CatDescriptText: Miss Gladys Jones, 2810 Barn Way, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 28, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "What do you think of race relations here in Pittsburgh?"  Answer reads: "In Pittsburgh, white and colored get along much better than they do in other cities. I like my race and also the white race as long as they don't practice any of that segregation stuff."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Gladys Jones holding opened umbrella and pile of clothing
